data.title: Degrees
data.solution:
<?php
fscanf(STDIN, "%d",
    $a
);
for ($i = 0; $i < $a; $i++)
{
    $name = stream_get_line(STDIN, 255 + 1, "\n");
    if (preg_match('/, ([A-Za-z.]+)/',$name,$array))
    {
        echo ($array[1]) . "\n";
    }
    else
        echo "N/A\n";
}
?>
data.statement:
Your job is to create a program that will output a person's degree, which is listed after their name in the input.

Warning: not all names have a degree. For these names you must output {{N/A}}.

data.stubGenerator:
read N:int
loop N read name:string(255)
loop N write degree
data.inputDescription:
<<First line:>> An integer [[N]] for how many names will be provided.
<<Next [[N]] lines:>> A [[name]], optionally containing a comma followed by a degree.

Note: names can contain non-alpha characters such as hyphens {{-}}, but a comma {{,}} is always followed by a degree. 

Note: degrees can contain capital, lowercase letters, spaces and periods.
data.outputDescription: <<One line per name>> containing that person's degree if it exists, {{N/A}} otherwise.

lastVersion.statementHTML:
Goal

Your job is to create a program that will output a person's degree, which is listed after their name in the input.

Warning: not all names have a degree. For these names you must output N/A.
Input
First line: An integer N for how many names will be provided.
Next N lines: A name, optionally containing a comma followed by a degree.

Note: names can contain non-alpha characters such as hyphens -, but a comma , is always followed by a degree.

Note: degrees can contain capital, lowercase letters, spaces and periods.
Output
One line per name containing that person's degree if it exists, N/A otherwise.
Constraints
0<N<20
Example
Input
2
James Morrison, BAS
Amy Jones
Output
BAS
N/A
